qas.question: List two alternatives to rotary stepper motors in printer applications.
In scanners, what do stepper motors move?
In printers and copiers, what do stepper motors move?

answers.text: print head carriage (of dot matrix and inkjet printers), and the platen or feed rollers

qas.question: List two alternatives to rotary stepper motors in non-printer applications.
In scanners, what don't stepper motors move?
In printers and copiers, what don't stepper motors move?

context: Stepper motors were and still are often used in computer printers, optical scanners, and digital photocopiers to move the <a1_0><b4_0>optical scanning element<b4_0/><a1_0/>, the <a2_0><b5_0>print head carriage<b5_0/> (of dot matrix and inkjet printers), and the platen or feed rollers<a2_0/>. Likewise, many computer plotters (which since the early 1990s have been replaced with large-format inkjet and laser printers) used rotary stepper motors for pen and platen movement; the typical alternatives here were either <a0_0><b3_0>linear stepper motors or servomotors<b3_0/><a0_0/> with closed-loop analog control systems.
